decks.notes: The main idea of this deck is to play aggressively with low-cost, efficient creatures like Delver of Secrets, Nimble Mongoose, and Tarmogoyf while disrupting the opponent's game plan with counterspells like Daze, Force of Will, Spell Pierce, and Spell Snare. The deck also aims to control the board with Wasteland and Stifle, and finish off opponents quickly with burn spells like Lightning Bolt. The inclusion of Winter Orb can slow down opponents' mana development, giving this aggro deck an edge in the late game.

This Merfolk deck aims to quickly overwhelm opponents with aggressive creatures like Lord of Atlantis and True-Name Nemesis, using synergy between creatures like Silvergill Adept and Master of the Pearl Trident to create a powerful board presence. The deck also includes disruption elements like Force of Will and Chalice of the Void to control the game and protect its threats. Additionally, cards like Aether Vial and Cavern of Souls provide mana acceleration and protection for the deck's creatures, ensuring that they can consistently apply pressure and close out games efficiently.

The deck focuses on using powerful control elements such as counterspells and removal spells to disrupt the opponent's game plan while also utilizing the Stoneforge Mystic package to search for and play powerful equipment like Batterskull and Umezawa's Jitte. The deck also includes versatile threats like True-Name Nemesis and Snapcaster Mage to apply pressure on the opponent. The inclusion of card advantage engines like Brainstorm and Jace, the Mind Sculptor allows the deck to maintain a steady stream of resources and outvalue the opponent in the long game.

The deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's strategy while applying pressure with efficient creatures. It utilizes cards like Stoneforge Mystic to search for powerful equipment, while Thalia, Guardian of Thraben slows down the opponent with taxing effects. The deck also includes disruptive creatures like Phyrexian Revoker and Karakas to handle threats. By controlling the board with cards like Mother of Runes and Flickerwisp, the deck aims to create a board presence that is difficult for the opponent to deal with, ultimately securing victory through aggressive plays and resource denial.

The main concept of this deck is to establish control over the game through a combination of card advantage, removal, and counter spells. The deck focuses on using cards like Terminus, Swords to Plowshares, and Force of Will to control the board while utilizing Snapcaster Mage and Jace, the Mind Sculptor to generate card advantage. The inclusion of Teferi, Hero of Dominaria and Search for Azcanta provides additional value and utility. The deck aims to dictate the pace of the game, disrupt opponent's strategy, and ultimately win through incremental advantage.

The main concept of this Grixis Control deck is to constantly disrupt the opponent's game plan while establishing card advantage through efficient removal spells and powerful card draw. The deck aims to control the pace of the game using a variety of disruption spells like Hymn to Tourach and Counterspell, along with removal spells like Fatal Push and Diabolic Edict. Additionally, the deck utilizes Snapcaster Mage to recur key spells from the graveyard and powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor to dominate the late game. The deck also utilizes a flexible mana base to ensure consistent access to all three colors.

The deck focuses on controlling the game by utilizing resource denial, land destruction, and powerful land combo pieces. It aims to slow down the opponent's game plan by disrupting their lands, while also setting up its own win condition through the Dark Depths combo. The deck uses cards like Exploration and Life from the Loam to quickly develop its mana base and recur key lands. Overall, the strategy revolves around outlasting and outmaneuvering the opponent through strong land interactions and efficient control elements.

The main concept of this Eldrazi Aggro deck is to play aggressive Eldrazi creatures and disrupt the opponent's game plan with cards like Wasteland, Thorn of Amethyst, and Chalice of the Void. The deck aims to use the powerful Eldrazi creatures like Reality Smasher, Thought-Knot Seer, and Endbringer to quickly overwhelm the opponent and close out the game. The deck also has some mana acceleration with cards like Eldrazi Temple and Ancient Tomb to help cast the expensive Eldrazi creatures. It uses disruptive elements like Chalice of the Void and Thorn of Amethyst to slow down the opponent while building a strong board presence.

This deck focuses on controlling the game through countering spells, card draw, and removal while setting up win conditions with cards like Monastery Mentor and Jace, the Mind Sculptor. The main strategy is to control the board using counterspells like Force of Will and removal like Swords to Plowshares, while using card draw effects like Brainstorm and Ponder to find answers and threats. The deck plays a proactive game plan with aggressive creatures like Monastery Mentor and powerful planeswalkers like Jace to close out the game.

The key strategy of this deck is to quickly assemble the combo pieces, either Show and Tell or Cunning Wish, to cheat in an Emrakul, the Aeons Torn or Omniscience onto the battlefield. By casting Show and Tell or using Cunning Wish to grab key spells from the sideboard, the deck can generate a game-winning advantage in a single turn. The deck also includes various cantrips and counterspells to dig for combo pieces, protect the combo, and disrupt opponent's game plan.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly generate a large amount of mana using cards like Lotus Petal and Lion's Eye Diamond, and then cast spells like Dark Ritual, Cabal Ritual, and Infernal Tutor to build up a storm count. Once a high enough storm count is reached, the player can finish off their opponent with a lethal Tendrils of Agony or Empty the Warrens. The deck is also equipped with disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Duress to control the game and protect the combo.

The deck focuses on using land control to slow down the opponent and lock them out of the game. It utilizes cards like Wasteland, Rishadan Port, and Ghost Quarter to disrupt the opponent's mana base. The key win condition is to assemble the Dark Depths and Thespian's Stage combo to create a 20/20 Marit Lage token. It also incorporates cards like Ensnaring Bridge and Maze of Ith for additional defense. The deck aims to grind out the opponent with cards like Punishing Fire and Life from the Loam, while also having some utility with cards like Engineered Explosives and Sylvan Library.

The deck focuses on controlling the opponent's resources through various land destruction effects while setting up a powerful combo with Dark Depths and Thespian's Stage to create a 20/20 indestructible creature. It also utilizes Life from the Loam to repeatedly return key lands from the graveyard and maintain card advantage. With cards like Punishing Fire and Molten Vortex for direct damage, alongside powerful utility lands like Karakas and The Tabernacle at Pendrell Vale, the deck seeks to outvalue and outlast the opponent in a grindy game plan.

This control deck aims to manage the board and opponent's threats through a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and card advantage. It utilizes cards like Search for Azcanta, Snapcaster Mage, and Jace, the Mind Sculptor to generate card advantage and control the game. By using efficient interaction like Swords to Plowshares and Force of Will, along with powerful cards like Terminus and Entreat the Angels, the deck aims to answer threats while setting up its win conditions. The deck aims to control the game until it can establish a dominant position and win the game.

The main concept of this deck is to generate a high amount of mana quickly through cards like Dark Ritual and Lion's Eye Diamond, allowing the player to combo off with cards like Infernal Tutor and Tendrils of Agony to deal a large amount of damage to the opponent in a single turn. The deck also features cards like Brainstorm and Ponder to help with card selection and manipulation, as well as disruption cards like Duress and Cabal Therapy to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The goal is to assemble the combo pieces and win the game in one explosive turn.

The deck focuses on controlling the game by utilizing counterspells and removal spells to disrupt the opponent's strategy, while also leveraging powerful equipment like Umezawa's Jitte and Sword of Fire and Ice to gain an advantage in combat. The deck also includes efficient card draw and filtering with cards like Brainstorm and Ponder to ensure consistent draws. Additionally, creatures like True-Name Nemesis and Stoneforge Mystic provide threats that can quickly close out the game. Overall, the deck aims to maintain control of the game while steadily improving its own position.
